269: Get to know The Pok mon Company International The Pok mon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pok mon Company in Japan, manages the property outside of Asia and is responsible for brand management, licensing, marketing, the Pok mon Trading Card Game, the animated TV series, home entertainment, and the official Pok mon website. Pok mon was launched in Japan in 1996 and today is one of the most popular children's entertainment properties in the world. Learn more online at Pokemon.com and on Facebook (facebook.com/pokemon), YouTube (youtube.com/pokemon), Twitter (twitter.com/pokemon), and Instagram (instagram.com/pokemon). Get to know the role Job Title: Principal Treasury Job Summary: This role will coordinate the company's banking position, including the management of global cash activities to maintain appropriate funding levels in corporate accounts. FLSA Classification (US Only): Exempt People Manager: No What you ll do Monitor and analyze company cash positions to cover cash commitments. Compiles short-term and long-term cash forecasts and coordinates the movement of any excess cash to and from investment accounts. Evaluates bank services and fees, monitors bank performance and recommends appropriate action. Research economic trends and investment opportunities. Monitors portfolio investments and produces management reports detailing performance. Manage foreign exchange risk by assessing exposure and executing FX revenue and balance sheet hedging programs. Design and maintain investment policy. Design and maintain internal control and policy requirements. Collaborate cross-functionally to achieve Treasury s agenda Develop or refine essential Treasury processes to achieve our strategic goals Support other treasury and finance projects as needed What you ll bring CPA, CTP, or CFA designation preferred. Eight (8) years, or more, of relevant professional experience or a demonstrated equivalent level of expertise. Bachelor's degree in a related field or a demonstrated equivalent level of applicable experience. An intact knowledge of cash management principles and experience with their application at a global level. Experience in managing complex banking and organizational structures and working with banking systems and processes. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail and accuracy. A passion for leading change through process improvements and automation. The ability to earn trust and maintain positive and professional relationships.
